Detailed Description

A Stream way to read primitive data.

All read requests made by calling methods in this class are directly forwarded to the equivalent function of the underlying operating system.

The following example demonstrates how to use this BufferedInputStream class.

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstanceState) {
     gaia::storage::File* file = new gaia::storage::File("inputfile.txt");

     gaia::storage::FileInputStream* fin = new gaia::storage::FileInputStream(file);
     gaia::storage::BufferedInputStream* bin = new gaia::storage::BufferedInputStream(fin);

     gaia::base::ByteArray contents(1024);

     int32_t bytesRead = 0;
     gaia::base::String* s = NULL;

     while ((bytesRead = bin->read(contents)) != -1) {
         s = new gaia::base::String(contents, 0, bytesRead);
     }

     bin->close();
     fin->close();
 }
See also:
BufferedOutputStream

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

gaia::storage::BufferedInputStream::BufferedInputStream ( const storage::InputStream &  in) [explicit]

Constructs a new BufferedInputStream, providing in with a buffer of 8192 bytes.

Warning: passing a NULL source creates a closed BufferedInputStream. All read operations on such a stream will fail with an IOException.

Parameters:
inthe InputStream the buffer reads from.
gaia::storage::BufferedInputStream::BufferedInputStream ( const storage::InputStream &  in,
int32_t  size 
)

Constructs a new BufferedInputStream, providing in with size bytes of buffer.

Warning: passing a NULL source creates a closed BufferedInputStream. All read operations on such a stream will fail with an IOException.

Parameters:
inthe InputStream the buffer reads from.
sizethe size of buffer in bytes.

Member Function Documentation

int32_t gaia::storage::BufferedInputStream::available ( ) [virtual]

Returns an estimated number of bytes that can be read or skipped without blocking for more input.

This method returns the number of bytes available in the buffer plus those available in the source stream, but see InputStream#available for important caveats.

Returns:
the estimated number of bytes available

Reimplemented from gaia::storage::InputStream.

void gaia::storage::BufferedInputStream::close ( ) [virtual]

Closes this stream.

The source stream is closed and any resources associated with it are released.

Reimplemented from gaia::storage::InputStream.

void gaia::storage::BufferedInputStream::mark ( int32_t  readlimit) [virtual]

Sets a mark position in this stream.

The parameter readlimit indicates how many bytes can be read before a mark is invalidated. Calling reset() will reposition the stream back to the marked position if readlimit has not been surpassed. The underlying buffer may be increased in size to allow readlimit number of bytes to be supported.

Parameters:
readlimitthe number of bytes that can be read before the mark is invalidated.
See also:
reset()

Reimplemented from gaia::storage::InputStream.

bool gaia::storage::BufferedInputStream::markSupported ( ) [virtual]

Indicates whether BufferedInputStream supports the mark() and reset() methods.

Returns:
true for BufferedInputStreams.
See also:
mark(int32_t)
reset()

Reimplemented from gaia::storage::InputStream.

BufferedInputStream& gaia::storage::BufferedInputStream::operator= ( const BufferedInputStream &  o) [private]
int32_t gaia::storage::BufferedInputStream::read ( ) [virtual]

Reads a single byte from this stream and returns it as an integer in the range from 0 to 255.

Returns -1 if the end of the source string has been reached. If the internal buffer does not contain any available bytes then it is filled from the source stream and the first byte is returned.

Returns:
the byte read or -1 if the end of the source stream has been reached.

Implements gaia::storage::InputStream.

int32_t gaia::storage::BufferedInputStream::read ( const base::ByteArray &  buffer,
int32_t  offset,
int32_t  byteCount 
) [virtual]

Reads at most byteCount bytes from this stream and stores them in byte array buffer starting at offset offset.

Returns the number of bytes actually read or -1 if no bytes were read and the end of the stream was encountered. If all the buffered bytes have been used, a mark has not been set and the requested number of bytes is larger than the receiver's buffer size, this implementation bypasses the buffer and simply places the results directly into buffer.

Parameters:
bufferthe byte array in which to store the bytes read.
offsetthe initial position in buffer to store the bytes read from this stream.
byteCountthe maximum number of bytes to store in buffer.
Returns:
the number of bytes actually read or -1 if end of stream.

Reimplemented from gaia::storage::InputStream.

void gaia::storage::BufferedInputStream::reset ( ) [virtual]

Resets this stream to the last marked location.

See also:
mark(int32_t)

Reimplemented from gaia::storage::InputStream.

int64_t gaia::storage::BufferedInputStream::skip ( int64_t  byteCount) [virtual]

Skips byteCount bytes in this stream.

Subsequent calls to read will not return these bytes unless reset is used.

Parameters:
byteCountthe number of bytes to skip. skip does nothing and returns 0 if byteCount is less than zero.
Returns:
the number of bytes actually skipped.

Reimplemented from gaia::storage::InputStream.
